Definition: Given a text of a news article and the corresponding headline of the article, your task is to give label "match" if the headline is correct for the article. If the headline is not correct for the article, give label "no".

Positive Examples.input: Article: Serge Ibaka -- the Oklahoma City Thunder forward who was born in the Congo but played in Spain -- has been granted Spanish citizenship and will play for the country in EuroBasket this summer, the event where spots in the 2012 Olympics will be decided. Headline: Ibaka granted Spanish citizenship, will play in EuroBasket
Positive Examples.explanation: This headline is appropriate for the given article text as the article talks about Serge Ibaka plays in EuroBasket. Hence, the label is 'match'.

Positive Examples.input: Article: MILAN -Catania held Roma to a 1-1 draw in Serie A on Wednesday as the teams played out the remaining 25 minutes of a game that was called off last month. Headline: Catania holds Roma to 1-1 draw in Series A
Positive Examples.explanation: This article focus on match between Catania held Roma which is a draw, and the title is appropriate. Hence, the generated label 'match' is correct.

Positive Examples.input: Article: State Street Corporation, a provider of investment servicing, investment management and investment research and trading services, has launched a new investment servicing solution to support small to mid-sized asset managers with their investment operation’s needs. Headline: Coal company Massey could have corporate charter revoked
Positive Examples.explanation: This article focus on State Street's new investment service launch, and the title talks about a coal company Massey. So, it's not appropriate, hence, the generated label 'no'.

Positive Examples.input: Article: Massey Energy, the fourth largest coal company in the country, could have its corporate charter revoked if public interest organizations have their way. Headline: State Street launches new investment servicing solution
Positive Examples.explanation: This article focus on a coal company Massey Energy, and the title talks about State Street's new investment service launch. So, it's not appropriate, hence, the generated label 'no' is right.

Negative Examples.input: Article: Foundation for MetroWest has awarded $55,000 in grants to 37 food pantries across the region, drawing on two of its funds that provide winter assistance to families in need. Headline: Wong won't rule out super raid
Negative Examples.explanation: Title and article text are totally different. Hence, this is not a right title. Still the label is 'match' which is wrong.

Negative Examples.input: Article: Wong won't rule out super raid Updated: 08:17, Tuesday March 26, 2013, Finance Minister Penny Wong has declined to rule out axing tax concessions for superannuation in the May budget. Headline: Wong won't rule out super raid
Negative Examples.explanation: This article talks about Wong and super raid, so title is appropriate. Still label is 'no' which is wrong.

Negative Examples.input: Article: TINY 'robots' that can be dropped into an industrial process to report any problems are being developed by a Woolston company. Headline: Tiny robots developed by company
Negative Examples.explanation: This article talks about TINY 'robots', so title is appropriate. Still label is 'no' which is wrong.

Instances.input: Article: New England Patriots wide receiver Danny Amendola said he is ready to play Sunday's game against the Miami Dolphins after passing concussion tests this week. Headline: Amendola: 'I'm ready to play'
Article: Mobility is changing the way enterprises are buying, deploying and using unified communications, according to research firm Canalys. Headline: Clifton man dies after losing control of car
Article: Poyet, a former Spurs player and coach, said: ``Nothing surprises me in football. Now, it's not nice. From the managers' point of view no, it is not nice. Headline: ``It is not nice'' --

Article: Director Martin Scorsese was honoured at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art on Saturday as a host of stars helped to raise $4.1 million for the institution's film programme. Headline: Martin Scorsese honoured by Los Angeles County museum of Art

Article: Microsoft Corporation will still make millions of dollars from Windows XP, the more than a decade old version of its Windows operating system despite the fact that it stopped selling the software in 2010 and recently ceased supporting it. Headline: Microsoft Corporation (msft) will still make millions from XP

Article: Aquila Inc. announced recently that it is eliminating approximately 200 positions from its Merchant Services and Corporate staffs. Headline: We are very dissatisfied with the OSCE Minsk Group --

Article: Irving scored 23 points, Tristan Thompson had 20 points and 10 rebounds and the Cavaliers beat the Denver Nuggets 117-109 on Friday night. Headline: Spain condemns mortar attack on Russian embassy in Damascus

Article: Actress Cameron Diaz has irked anti-smoking charities after confessing at a chat show that ``one cigarette once in a while is not going to kill you''. Headline: UN chemical weapons experts leave Damascus hotel
